The Thug Myth Project

From the space of misinterpreting and mislabeling black male bodies emerges the Thug Myth Project —a passion-filled transmedia project aimed at debunking one of many myths about the black man.

We are swapping stories. We are assembling narratives. We are shouting out to all the black male bodies of our villages to stand strong in their skin—a skin so often objectified by a world lost in labels. Using our words not our fists, our tears not our blood, our hearts not our hate—we are dictating that not only do black lives matter, they are necessary. We must take control of our own images so consistently appropriated or distorted into a reason to take us out.

Using cameras not guns, the Thug Myth Project will capture and reflect images of the black male body in a way that is far too absent from today’s entertainment line up. The lives taken are real. So these lives portrayed are purposed at saving life—at ripping apart that ugly thug myth.
